metadata.background_info:
Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. is the incumbent US President after winning the 2020 election. He has stated multiple times his intention of running for re-election, particularly if the Republican nominee would be Donald Trump. A March 2022 poll by CNN found 52% of respondents expected Biden not to run for re-election, compared to 29% who predicted that he would.
The previous US President Donald Trump has expressed several hints of his desire to run for re-election, stopping short of officially filing his campaign.
The 2024 United States presidential election is scheduled for Tuesday, November 5, 2024.

Q.title: Will at least one US state secede from the Union before 31 December, 2030?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
The United States of America has in the past acquired new territories, such as the Alaskan purchase of 1867, and the purchase of the former Danish West Indies in 1917. Sometimes territories have changed status, such as when Hawaii became a state in 1959. However, no state has so far left the union without a civil war ensuing and eventually causing its reintegration. However, there are currently active secessionist movements in several US states, some which have appreciable levels of support. A 2014 poll showed that 58% of Alaskans favored a secession from the union. Will a US state agree to leave the union before end of 2030?
The question resolves in the affirmative if any US state leave the union.
Resolution details:
The procedure to leave the US state need not go through official legislative channels (e.g. introducing a bill to leave the union and this bill receives majority support in the state legislature)
In case the process does not occur through official legislative channels, the question resolves positively if credible news media reports that the US State has seceded, or has been ejected out of the union
Positive resolution requires the relevant state to have existed at least one year prior to its secession
For example, granting entry to the union to some territory, and subsequently revoking it within one year is not sufficient for positive resolution

R.title: Will there be a global thermonuclear war by 2070?
R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there is an armed conflict before January 1, 2070 where either of the following conditions are true:
Three countries each detonate at least 10 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory
Two countries each detonate at least 50 nuclear devices of at least 10 kiloton yield outside of their own territory.
These conditions are chosen to set aside a two-party regional nuclear war, say between India and Pakistan, or Israel and an adversary, or the UK and France, as disastrous as that would be.
As with many questions with a positive-resolution condition that may preclude being awarded points on Metaculus, predictors are enjoined to predict in good faith, as points will not be awarded until 2070 anyway

metadata.background_info:
Weapons in which the energy is provided by nuclear fission or fusion have only twice in history been detonated outside of a controlled test environment, in the Hiroshima and Nagasaki events in World War II.
Since then, the world has nearly gone to nuclear war as a result of international conflict (during the Cuban Missile Crisis) and by accident. (Indeed, there have been a number of narrowly-averted accidental nuclear detonations. See this timeline for a sobering look at how close we have come.)
This question (which any sane person will hope resolves negatively) regards the probability that a nuclear war will occur by Jan 1, 2070. (Different questions address this separately, but none directly.) There is a great paucity of public and useful estimates of this probability. See for example this paper for an outline of considerations (but no bottom-line numbers.)

reasons: The election of Donald Trump in 2024 could lead to significant political and social changes in the United States, which might influence secessionist movements. For example, states with strong opposition to Trump might be more inclined to consider secession.

The election of Donald Trump could also impact international relations and global stability, potentially increasing the likelihood of a global thermonuclear war by 2070. His foreign policy decisions and diplomatic approach could either escalate or de-escalate tensions with other nuclear-armed nations.

The secession of a US state could be indicative of extreme political instability within the United States, which might have broader implications for global stability and the likelihood of a global thermonuclear war.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is somewhat reasonable as there are potential causal links between the election of Donald Trump, US state secession, and global thermonuclear war.

P.title: Will a Nobel Prize for Economics be awarded for MMT before 2041?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any Nobel Prize for Economic Sciences is awarded before January 1, 2041 where both of these conditions are true:
A. To a person who, at any point, identifies as a founder, developer, or core contributor to MMT OR is considered as one of the core contributors or founders of MMT according to at least one peer-reviewed review articles or book chapter on the topic.
B. The justification for the prize by the committee attributes the award to that person's contribution to MMT, Macroeconomics, or a core macroeconomics principle/idea (deficit, inflation, interest rates, government bonds, reserves)
This question will resolve as No if no Nobel Prize is awarded which satisfies those conditions. If there is disagreement on whether the award is "for" contributions to MMT, the determination will be made at Metaculus' sole discretion

Q_given_P.title: Given a Nobel Prize for Economics is awarded for MMT before 2041, will North Korea and South Korea be recognized as a unified sovereign state by 2045?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: A Nobel Prize for Economic Sciences is awarded before January 1, 2041 where both of these conditions are met:
A. To a person who, at any point, identifies as a founder, developer, or core contributor to MMT OR is considered as one of the core contributors or founders of MMT according to at least one peer-reviewed review articles or book chapter on the topic.
B. The justification for the prize by the committee attributes the award to that person's contribution to MMT, Macroeconomics, or a core macroeconomics principle/idea (deficit, inflation, interest rates, government bonds, reserves).

Then, is it true that North Korea and South Korea will be recognized as a single sovereign state by 2045? This question resolves positively if either:
- North Korea and South Korea (or their respective descendants if they change name) merge.
- North Korea, South Korea or both (or their respective descendants if they change name) stop existing, and an entity (possibly the one that's left) controls 90%+ of the current North Korea + South Korea landmass and has its capital on that territory.
Resolution will be by reputable source that either has happened, as judged by Metaculus mods/admins.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that both a Nobel Prize for Economics is awarded for MMT before 2041 and Korea is recognized as a unified sovereign state by 2045, will the People's Republic of China control at least half of Taiwan before 2050?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for each part:

1. Nobel Prize for Economics and MMT:
This question will resolve as Yes if any Nobel Prize for Economic Sciences is awarded before January 1, 2041 where both of these conditions are true:
A. To a person who, at any point, identifies as a founder, developer, or core contributor to MMT OR is considered as one of the core contributors or founders of MMT according to at least one peer-reviewed review articles or book chapter on the topic.
B. The justification for the prize by the committee attributes the award to that person's contribution to MMT, Macroeconomics, or a core macroeconomics principle/idea (deficit, inflation, interest rates, government bonds, reserves).
This question will resolve as No if no Nobel Prize is awarded which satisfies those conditions. If there is disagreement on whether the award is "for" contributions to MMT, the determination will be made at Metaculus' sole discretion.

2. Korea as a Unified Sovereign State:
All of Korea had been unified as a single state for centuries. After World War II and beginning in the Cold War, Korea was divided into two countries along the 38th parallel (now the Korean Demilitarized Zone). In 1950, North Korea invaded the South, beginning the Korean War, which ended in stalemate in 1953.
Even after the end of the Korean War, reunification proved a challenge as the two countries became increasingly diverged at a steady pace. However, in the late 2010s, relations between North and South Korea warmed somewhat, beginning with North Korea's participation at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea. In 2019, South Korean president Moon Jae-in proposed reunification of the two divided states in the Korean peninsula by 2045.
The question resolves positively if either:
North Korea and South Korea (or their respective descendants if they change name) merge.
or
North Korea, South Korea or both (or their respective descendants if they change name) stop existing, and an entity (possibly the one that's left) controls 90%+ of the current North Korea + South Korea landmass and has its capital on that territory.
Resolution will be by reputable source that either has happened, as judged by Metaculus mods/admins.

3. Control of Taiwan by the People's Republic of China:
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occur between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050:
There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, includes areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
Fine Print
A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.

This question will resolve as Yes if any Nobel Prize for Economic Sciences is awarded before January 1, 2041 where both of these conditions are true:
A. To a person who, at any point, identifies as a founder, developer, or core contributor to MMT OR is considered as one of the core contributors or founders of MMT according to at least one peer-reviewed review articles or book chapter on the topic.
B. The justification for the prize by the committee attributes the award to that person's contribution to MMT, Macroeconomics, or a core macroeconomics principle/idea (deficit, inflation, interest rates, government bonds, reserves)
This question will resolve as No if no Nobel Prize is awarded which satisfies those conditions. If there is disagreement on whether the award is "for" contributions to MMT, the determination will be made at Metaculus' sole discretion

metadata.background_info:
Modern Monetary Theory is currently a heterodox economics theory.
MMT is debated with active dialogues about its theoretical integrity, the implications of the policy recommendations of its proponents, and the extent to which it is actually divergent from orthodox macroeconomics.

Q.title: Will North Korea and South Korea be recognized as a unified sovereign state by 2045?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
All of Korea had been unified as a single state for centuries. After World War II and beginning in the Cold War, Korea was divided into two countries along the 38th parallel (now the Korean Demilitarized Zone). In 1950, North Korea invaded the South, beginning the Korean War, which ended in stalemate in 1953.
Even after the end of the Korean War, reunification proved a challenge as the two countries became increasingly diverged at a steady pace. However, in the late 2010s, relations between North and South Korea warmed somewhat, beginning with North Korea's participation at the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea. In 2019, South Korean president Moon Jae-in proposed reunification of the two divided states in the Korean peninsula by 2045.
Will North Korea and South Korea be recognized as a single sovereign state by 2045?
The question resolves positively if either:
North Korea and South Korea (or their respective descendants if they change name) merge.
or
North Korea, South Korea or both (or their respective descendants if they change name) stop existing, and an entity (possibly the one that's left) controls 90%+ of the current North Korea + South Korea landmass and has its capital on that territory.
Resolution will be by reputable source that either has happened, as judged by Metaculus mods/admins.

R.title: Will the People's Republic of China control at least half of Taiwan before 2050?
R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following occur between January 1, 2020 and January 1, 2050:
There are at least five reliable articles listing areas controlled by the People's Republic of China, includes areas of the current territory ("free area" as of October 2020) of the Republic of China (including the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu) which amount to at least half the population of the current territory of the ROC, according to the latest reliable population demographic data.
There are at least five non-opinion articles from different reliable sources asserting that the PRC controls at least half or most of Taiwan.
There are at least five articles (including opinion articles) from different reliable sources asserting that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC and citing evidence that the government of the majority of the ROC is de facto controlled by China, and the ROC (rather than a third state) controls at least half of the current territory of the ROC. Articles which, in the judgment of Metaculus, are hyperbole or otherwise do not make a strong case that the ROC is a puppet state of the PRC will not count.
Fine Print
A peaceful reunification of China and Taiwan would result in this question resolving Yes.
Articles must be written and published by different sources and must reach their conclusions largely independently, publishing the same article at a separate news outlet or several news outlets reporting statements made by the same individual or group of individuals will not count as separate articles.

metadata.background_info:
The People's Republic of China (PRC), governing mainland China including Hainan, Hong Kong, and Macau, has wanted to acquire control of the territory of the Republic of China (ROC), governing the islands of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen, and Matsu. This process might happen if the ROC makes a clear statement of independence from the PRC, and the PRC invades in response and succeeds. In May 2020, PRC General Li Zuocheng said “If the possibility for peaceful reunification is lost, the people’s armed forces will, with the whole nation, including the people of Taiwan, take all necessary steps to resolutely smash any separatist plots or actions.” Foreign Policy thinks “Beijing is unlikely to invade Taiwan during the pandemic”, which raises the question of longer timespans. There are questions as to if/when China would be able to win a military conflict, or whether the US would defend Taiwan.
Alternatively, the ROC may voluntarily choose to unify with the PRC. Currently, the majority of the Taiwanese public is in favor of maintaining the "status quo" and is against unification with China. Over 70% believes that the Republic of China is an independent country. 6.7% believes that Taiwan and China should be unified as soon as possible (The Diplomat).

reasons: The Nobel Prize for Economics being awarded for MMT could indicate a significant shift in economic thinking and policy, which might influence geopolitical strategies, including those of China and the Koreas.
The unification of North and South Korea would have major geopolitical implications, potentially affecting China's strategy towards Taiwan and its broader regional ambitions.

China's control over Taiwan would have significant geopolitical ramifications, potentially influencing global economic policies and alliances, which could be related to the economic theories recognized by the Nobel Prize.
relevance.conclusion: The logical combination of these questions is somewhat relevant due to the interconnected nature of global geopolitics and economic policies.

P.title: Will there be an AI Sputnik moment before 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
There is said to be an "AI Sputnik moment" if ANY of the following come true before 2050,
A major technology company (>50 billion dollar market cap, in 2021 US dollars, right before the announcement) announces the creation of an AI system. Upon the announcement, their stock price skyrockets by over 100% compared to its previous value within 7 days, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock price is likely a result of the AI development.
News of an AI development triggers the head of government of the top 2 nations by GDP nominal to give a public speech regarding the ramifications of this particular AI development, within two weeks of the initial news reports.
The Nasdaq Composite (which is currently heavily weighted towards companies in the information technology sector) rises over 30% in the course of a single week, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock prices is likely a result of the AI development.
The Google Trends monitor for artificial intelligence shows that interest in artificial intelligence rises by over 100% relative to of its previous value, compared to the week prior (using the resolution at 12 months, as currently displayed by the Google Trends widget). If Google Trends changes their functionality or methodology dramatically (as determined by Metaculus admins), then this condition can no longer trigger a positive resolution.
Practically all reliable media outlets are referring to an AI development as an AI Sputnik moment, as referring to the historical Sputnik 1 satellite
Fine Print
Google Trends index scores vary depending on the date and location from which a user checks the site. To reduce ambiguity, to trigger the Google Trends section of the resolution criteria:
At least two Metaculus administrators need to be able to see the >100% Google Trends increase, when checking from different locations.
The increase must remain >100% for at least four days to trigger a Yes resolution. For instance, if we first notice an increase of >100% on a Monday, we will check again on Friday. We will only resolve "Yes" if the reported increase for the weeks in question is >100% on both days we check, for both admins, and we have no evidence that it dropped below 100% at any point during those four days.

Q_given_P.title: Given an AI Sputnik moment occurs before 2050, will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
Q_given_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is an "AI Sputnik moment" before 2050, defined by any of the following criteria being met:
- A major technology company (>50 billion dollar market cap, in 2021 US dollars, right before the announcement) announces the creation of an AI system. Upon the announcement, their stock price skyrockets by over 100% compared to its previous value within 7 days, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock price is likely a result of the AI development.
- News of an AI development triggers the head of government of the top 2 nations by GDP nominal to give a public speech regarding the ramifications of this particular AI development, within two weeks of the initial news reports.
- The Nasdaq Composite (which is currently heavily weighted towards companies in the information technology sector) rises over 30% in the course of a single week, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock prices is likely a result of the AI development.
- The Google Trends monitor for artificial intelligence shows that interest in artificial intelligence rises by over 100% relative to of its previous value, compared to the week prior (using the resolution at 12 months, as currently displayed by the Google Trends widget). If Google Trends changes their functionality or methodology dramatically (as determined by Metaculus admins), then this condition can no longer trigger a positive resolution.
- Practically all reliable media outlets are referring to an AI development as an AI Sputnik moment, as referring to the historical Sputnik 1 satellite.

Then, will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040? This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given both an AI Sputnik moment before 2050 and US life expectancy falling below 75 years before 2040, will a geoengineering act of Congress become US federal law by the end of 2024?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Suppose the following is true: An AI Sputnik moment occurs before 2050, defined by any of the following criteria being met: a major technology company announces the creation of an AI system leading to a stock price surge over 100% within 7 days, with credible media attributing this rise to the AI development; a head of government from one of the top 2 GDP nations speaks on the AI development within 2 weeks of initial reports; the Nasdaq Composite rises over 30% in a week due to AI development; or Google Trends shows a more than 100% increase in AI interest, with specific viewing conditions met by Metaculus administrators. Additionally, US life expectancy at birth for both sexes falls below 75 years before 2040, as confirmed by the CDC, WHO, or the UN. Then, is it true that a geoengineering act of Congress, defined as "the deliberate large-scale manipulation of the planetary environment to counteract anthropogenic climate change," becomes US federal law by the end of 2024? This would involve the enactment of a geoengineering bill introduced in the House of Representatives and/or the Senate, signed into law by the U.S. president or otherwise enacted, with the bill being identified through a Congress website search using terms related to geoengineering.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) an AI Sputnik moment before 2050, and (2) US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040, and (3) a geoengineering act of Congress become US federal law by the end of 2024?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria for AI Sputnik Moment:

A major technology company (>50 billion dollar market cap, in 2021 US dollars, right before the announcement) announces the creation of an AI system. Upon the announcement, their stock price skyrockets by over 100% compared to its previous value within 7 days, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock price is likely a result of the AI development.
News of an AI development triggers the head of government of the top 2 nations by GDP nominal to give a public speech regarding the ramifications of this particular AI development, within two weeks of the initial news reports.
The Nasdaq Composite (which is currently heavily weighted towards companies in the information technology sector) rises over 30% in the course of a single week, and numerous highly credible media reports claim that this rise in stock prices is likely a result of the AI development.
The Google Trends monitor for artificial intelligence shows that interest in artificial intelligence rises by over 100% relative to of its previous value, compared to the week prior (using the resolution at 12 months, as currently displayed by the Google Trends widget). If Google Trends changes their functionality or methodology dramatically (as determined by Metaculus admins), then this condition can no longer trigger a positive resolution.
Practically all reliable media outlets are referring to an AI development as an AI Sputnik moment, as referring to the historical Sputnik 1 satellite
Fine Print for AI Sputnik Moment:
Google Trends index scores vary depending on the date and location from which a user checks the site. To reduce ambiguity, to trigger the Google Trends section of the resolution criteria:
At least two Metaculus administrators need to be able to see the >100% Google Trends increase, when checking from different locations.
The increase must remain >100% for at least four days to trigger a Yes resolution. For instance, if we first notice an increase of >100% on a Monday, we will check again on Friday. We will only resolve "Yes" if the reported increase for the weeks in question is >100% on both days we check, for both admins, and we have no evidence that it dropped below 100% at any point during those four days.
Resolution Criteria for US Life Expectancy:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question
Resolution Criteria for Geoengineering Act:
This question resolves positively if a geoengineering bill that is introduced in the House of Representatives and/or the Senate is subsequently enacted as legislation (by being signed by the U.S. president, or through other means) before or on 31/12/2024. For the purpose of this question, a geoengineering bill is any bill reported by the relevant Congress website search. This search involves the following terms:
"Climate engineering" OR "geoengineering" OR "Solar radiation management" OR "Stratospheric Particle Injection" OR "Stratospheric aerosol injection" OR "Marine cloud brightening" OR "Ocean sulfur cycle enhancement"

metadata.background_info:
From Wikipedia,
Sputnik 1 was the first artificial Earth satellite. It was launched into an elliptical low Earth orbit by the USSR on 4 October 1957 as part of the Soviet space program. It orbited for three weeks before its batteries died and then orbited silently for two months before it fell back into the atmosphere on the 4th January 1958.
[...]
The satellite's unanticipated success precipitated the American Sputnik crisis and triggered the Space Race, part of the Cold War. The launch was the beginning of a new era of political, military, technological and scientific developments.
An "AI Sputnik moment" would, by contrast, be a sudden understanding by the general public that artificial intelligence is worth taking extremely seriously, perhaps triggering a similar AI arms race.

Q.title: Will US life expectancy at birth for both sexes fall below 75 years before 2040?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2020 to January 1, 2040, US life expectancy at birth (average for both sexes) is less than 75 years, according to the CDC, World Health Organization, or the United Nations. An official statement by any one of those organizations is sufficient to resolve the question

metadata.background_info:
According to the United Nations Development Program's 2019 Human Development Index, the average life expectancy at birth in the US (both sexes, average) is 78.9 years.
Life expectancy in the US has increased by just under a decade since 1950, when it was 68.14 years. However, in the last few years, life expectancy has actually declined slightly in the US. Contributing factors include obesity and related diseases, opioid abuse, and suicides.

R.title: Will a geoengineering act of Congress become US federal law by the end of 2024?
R.body:
Resolution Criteria
Climate change geoengineering, defined by the United Kingdom’s Royal Society as “the deliberate large-scale manipulation of the planetary environment to counteract anthropogenic climate change” (Shepherd et al. 2009). Geoengineering involves the removal of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere, or attempts at reflecting more energy away from the planet to counter warming (Markusson et al., 2013). Geoengineering is often presented as a complement, and sometimes alternative, to climate mitigation and adaptation.
There are serious and complex governance issues which need to be resolved if geoengineering is ever to become an acceptable method for moderating climate change. It would be highly undesirable for irreversible global geoengineering to occur before appropriate governance mechanisms are in place. The Royal Society has published a set of geoengineering governance principles, known as The Oxford Principles, which aims to guide the collaborative development of geoengineering governance, from the earliest stages of research, to any eventual deployment. These principles are:
Principle 1: Geoengineering is to be regulated as a public good
Principle 2: The public should participate in geoengineering decision-making
Principle 3: Geoengineering research and results should be publicly disclosed
Principle 4: There should be independent assessments of the impacts
Principle 5: governance systems should be developed before geoengineering methods are deployed
As of September 2019, two geoengineering bills and one resolution have been introduced in Congress. These bills are the following:
Geoengineering Research Evaluation Act of 2017. This bill recommends a research agenda for advancing understanding of albedo modification strategies that involve atmospheric interventions, such as cloud modification; and a report that provides specific guidance on the governance mechanisms for the proposed research agenda.
American Clean Energy Leadership Act of 2009. This bill requires the Secretary of Energy to establish an Advisory Committee on Geosciences and Geoengineering Education to advise the Secretary in education and training in the subsurface geosciences and engineering.
Neither the Geoengineering Research Evaluation Act of 2017 nor the American Clean Energy Leadership Act of 2009 became legislation. So far, the U.S. has not enacted legislation that are explicitly related to geoengineering.
Will a geoengineering act of Congress become US federal law by the end of 2024?
This questions resolves positively if a geoengineering bill that is introduced in the House of Representatives and/or the Senate is subsequently enacted as legislation (by being signed by the U.S. president, or through other means) before or on 31/12/2024. For the purpose of this question, a geoengineering bill is any bill reported by the relevant Congress website search. This search involves the following terms:
"Climate engineering" OR "geoengineering" OR "Solar radiation management" OR "Stratospheric Particle Injection" OR "Stratospheric aerosol injection" OR "Marine cloud brightening" OR "Ocean sulfur cycle enhancement"

reasons: An 'AI Sputnik moment' could lead to significant technological advancements and shifts in policy, which might influence public health and environmental policies, potentially affecting life expectancy and the likelihood of geoengineering legislation.
A major AI breakthrough could lead to economic and social changes that might impact healthcare systems, potentially influencing life expectancy.
Geoengineering legislation could be influenced by technological advancements and public perception, which might be affected by an AI breakthrough.
relevance.conclusion: There are plausible reasons to consider the logical combination of these questions, as technological advancements and policy shifts could have interconnected impacts on life expectancy and environmental legislation.
